thread.title: Southampton striker Austin may return for West Ham clash

title: Southampton striker Austin may return for West Ham clash
text: March 17, 2018 / 1:20 PM / Updated 35 minutes ago Southampton striker Austin may return for West Ham clash Reuters Staff 2 Min Read (Reuters) - Southampton striker Charlie Austin has stepped up his recovery from a hamstring injury and could return in time for their next Premier League game against West Ham United at the end of the month, the club’s new manager Mark Hughes has said. Soccer Football - Premier League - Southampton vs Huddersfield Town - St Mary's Stadium, Southampton, Britain - December 23, 2017 Southampton's Charlie Austin goes off injured REUTERS/Peter Nicholls Austin has not played for 17th-placed Southampton since picking up the injury in December’s 1-1 draw with Huddersfield Town, a game in which he headed the opener to take his league tally to six goals from 16 appearances. “We’ve been speaking to Charlie over the last two days and he’s really encouraged by how it’s going,” Hughes, who took over from the sacked Mauricio Pellegrino on Wednesday, told the club’s website (www.southamptonfc.com). “We’ve got a chance of integrating him for short periods next week. If we can do that, we can speed up his progress... with a bit of luck, if we can get him ready for West Ham that’s a massive positive.” Southampton visit third-tier Wigan Athletic in the FA Cup quarter-finals on Sunday before returning to league action on March 31 with a trip to West Ham. Saints have 28 points, two behind the Hammers and just one above the relegation zone. Reporting by Shrivathsa Sridhar in Bengaluru; Editing by Ken Ferris
